intro: Guatteria intermedia, commonly known as the Mexican soursop or Guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, followed by fleshy, spiky fruits resembling a soursop. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
